qas.question: What major trends appeared in Mesoamerica during 4500 BC?
What term is used to describe the mid-late Neolithic era in American education?
What term is used to describe the Early Neolithic era in American education?
What hunting weapon was found in the Southwestern US during  500 to 1200 C.E.?
What major trends appeared in Mesoamerica during 11,000 BC?
What term is used to describe the mid-late Neolithic era in Asian education?
What term is used to describe the Early Neolithic era in Asian education?
What hunting weapon was found in the Southwestern US during 1200 to 500 BC?
When was there a dramatic increase in turkeys?

context: In Mesoamerica, a similar set of events (i.e., <a0_0><b4_0>crop domestication and sedentary lifestyles<b4_0/><a0_0/>) occurred by around 4500 BC, but possibly as early as 11,000–10,000 BC. These cultures are usually not referred to as belonging to the Neolithic; in America different terms are used such as <a1_0><b5_0>Formative stage<b5_0/><a1_0/> instead of mid-late Neolithic, <a2_0><b6_0>Archaic Era<b6_0/><a2_0/> instead of Early Neolithic and Paleo-Indian for the preceding period. The Formative stage is equivalent to the Neolithic Revolution period in Europe, Asia, and Africa. In the Southwestern United States it occurred from <b8_0>500 to 1200 C.E.<b8_0/> when there was a dramatic increase in population and development of large villages supported by agriculture based on dryland farming of maize, and later, beans, squash, and domesticated turkeys. During this period the <a3_0><b7_0>bow and arrow<b7_0/><a3_0/> and ceramic pottery were also introduced.
